messages.content: ComfyUI-Transceiver is a python library that swiftly exchanges fundamental data structures, specifically numpy arrays, between processes to optimize AI inference tasks that utilize ComfyUI.

ComfyUI-Transceiver was developed because when processing a large number of requests, the SaveImage and LoadImage nodes may be IO-limited, and using shared memory improves performance by passing images only through memory access, not through IO.
How can ComfyUI-Transceiver be installed as ComfyUI custom nodes?
To install ComfyUI-Transceiver as ComfyUI custom nodes, you need to clone the repository into the custom_nodes directory of ComfyUI, install the requirements, and launch ComfyUI.
What does the Save Image Transceiver node do?
The Save Image Transceiver node saves an image to shared memory. It requires an ImageTensor input and a name input, where the name is the shared memory identical name.
What does the Load Image Transceiver node do?
The Load Image Transceiver node loads an image from shared memory. It requires a name input, where the name is the shared memory identical name.
What is the purpose of the name input in the Save Image Transceiver node?
The name input in the Save Image Transceiver node is used as the shared memory identical name, which is required to save the image to shared memory.
What is the purpose of the name input in the Load Image Transceiver node?
The name input in the Load Image Transceiver node is used as the shared memory identical name, which is required to load the image from shared memory.
